span.strong: Important Information concerning the Coronavirus for FCSC families and staff.

p.span: Per the Governor's request, FCSC offices will be closed until May 1st. If you need assistance during this time, you can email us at fcscconnect@fayette.k12.in.us or leave a voice message at 765-825-2178. Someone will get back to you as soon as possible. Please stay home and stay safe!

p.a: PARENT RESOURCES FOR REMOTE LEARNING - http://resource.fcsc.ws

div.p: A Fayette County student requesting a transfer to an elementary school outside of the district they are living in shall complete the Application for Elementary Transfer Request and submit it to the Fayette County School Corporation Assistant Superintendent's Office. Transfers will be considered on a yearly basis:

p.a: Appendix Form 5:09 Elementary Transfer Request Form

div.p: A student requesting a transfer shall complete the Application for Transfer of Non-Resident Student and submit it to the Fayette County School Corporation Assistant Superintendent's Office. Transfers will be considered on a yearly basis:

p.a: Appendix Form 5.09 B Out of County Transfer Students

br.p: Connersville High School is only one of 31 Early College High Schools in Indiana. For more information

img.style: border-width: 2px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(192, 80, 77); text-align: center;

em.span: The mission of the FCSC is to provide quality educational programs in an environment which is safe, harmonious, and conducive to learning,
enabling a diverse population of all ages to become independent, productive citizens and lifelong learners.
School safety is always changing in relation to potential threats to our students.
Recent safety measures have been implemented within all schools in our district.
These safety measures coincide with the physical and emotional safety of our students, staff, and visitors.
*The safety of our students is a priority in the Fayette County School Corporation and we thank you for your understanding and your support in enhancing the school safety protocols in our district.

div.p: The Fayette County School Corporation is asking parents of children who will be attending kindergarten next year to complete the online form. Your child must be 5 years old on or before August 1st to be eligible for kindergarten in the fall.

We are offering an Early Entrance Waiver for students who will be 5 years old on or before October 1st. You must complete the following form and return it to the Administration Office before JULY 22, 2020.
